content:
Diagnosis:
Metastatic clear cell renal cell carcinoma with brain and bone metastases

Previous treatment:
Right radical nephrectomy March 2023
Whole brain radiotherapy April 2023
Pazopanib commenced May 2023, discontinued July 2023 due to grade 3 hepatotoxicity
Cabozantinib commenced August 2023, discontinued October 2023 due to progressive disease
Palliative radiotherapy to T7-T9 October 2023

MDT Discussion Points:
1. Disease progression on second-line TKI
2. New neurological symptoms
3. Consideration of third-line options

Radiology Review:
MRI brain 15 November 2023 shows enlarging right parietal metastasis (3.2cm from 2.1cm) with increasing edema. Two new small frontal lesions.

CT chest/abdomen/pelvis 14 November 2023 demonstrates enlarging mediastinal lymphadenopathy and new liver lesions. Progressive bone metastases particularly T7 vertebral body with 50% height loss.

Current Clinical Status:
Performance status deteriorated to ECOG 3
Requiring dexamethasone 8mg BD for cerebral edema
Morphine SR 60mg BD for bone pain

MDT Outcome:
The MDT notes the rapid progression through two lines of TKI therapy. Given the high mTOR activity on original pathology review, we recommend commencing everolimus 10mg daily with close monitoring. The team acknowledges the poor prognosis but notes that third-line mTOR inhibition may offer disease control.

Plan:
1. Commence everolimus 10mg daily
2. Urgent neurosurgical review for consideration of resection/SRS to enlarging parietal metastasis
3. Maintain current dexamethasone dose
4. Weekly clinical review initially
5. Repeat imaging after 8 weeks of everolimus

Patient has been informed of MDT outcome and agrees with plan. [redacted name] (CNS) will coordinate care and provide additional support.

primary_cancer.metastases: brain metastases (right parietal and frontal), bone metastases (including T7-T9 vertebrae), mediastinal lymphadenopathy, liver metastases

cancer_timeline.value: Discontinued pazopanib due to grade 3 hepatotoxicity
Discontinued cabozantinib due to progressive disease
MRI brain shows enlarging right parietal metastasis (3.2cm from 2.1cm) with increasing edema and two new frontal lesions
CT shows enlarging mediastinal lymphadenopathy, new liver lesions, progressive bone metastases with T7 vertebral body height loss

patient_facts.value: Bone pain requiring morphine SR 60mg BD

status_updates.value: Metastatic renal cell carcinoma with rapid progression through two lines of TKI therapy. New neurological symptoms from enlarging brain metastases and deteriorating performance status.
Progressive disease with enlarging brain metastases, new liver lesions, and worsening bone metastases
Plan to commence everolimus 10mg daily as third-line therapy
Repeat imaging after 8 weeks of everolimus
Weekly clinical review and urgent neurosurgical review for consideration of resection/SRS to enlarging parietal metastasis
